column4: hey anyone running imagemagick?  what is the gui package called??
I wasn't aware there was a gui package for imagemagick.
ikonia, o i see.  crap.  lol.  either of you guys know an app that will allow me to do pdf to jpeg image conversions????
almost any image editor, but for bulk conversions imagemagick is really best, just use it from the terminal.
there are probably gui packages that do bulk conversions, I'm just used to doing some things on the command line.
yahhh,,, like gimp will do it, but its one at a time, which sucks
at the end of the day, batch conversions like that really do work best on the command line.  You just need to get used to it.
and to expand on what fiyawerx just told you, if you want to convert all the pdf files in a directory just do: for x in *.pdf; do convert $x ${x/.pdf/.jpg}; done
are you sure you spelled the filenames correctly?  realize that case does matter in Linux.
does the filename contain any funny characters or spaces?
no, but the spaces will.  enclose the filename in single-quotes like this: 'Business Guide - Law.pdf'
do that to both the pdf and jpg filenames.
what is the exact command you gave for imagemagick?
... ooooooooooo mannnnnnnnn... hahaha, so i did what unop just said, and same thing, pressed enter, and nothing happens, checked directory, and no files created.
paste the exact commadn you typed into here again
what unop just said, you only had part of the command.
